Job Title: Analyst, Research and Development

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Overview

Job Purpose

Intercontinental Exchange Inc.’s Sustainable Finance team provides financial market stakeholders with insights into environmental, social, and governance (ESG) risks and opportunities. Our cutting-edge technology and innovative approach to data analysis allow us to offer our clients a unique perspective on how their investment portfolios impact the world around them. We are committed to using our data to help organizations make more informed decisions and create a more sustainable future for all.

We are currently in search of a talented and driven Climate Transition Risk Analyst to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will possess a robust background in environmental science, finance, or a closely related field, coupled with a commitment to addressing the challenges posed by climate change within the context of businesses and financial markets. The successful candidate will play a key role within our organization, contributing to the development of innovative solutions at the intersection of sustainability and finance, and leveraging their expertise in data analysis and modeling.

Responsibilities

Collaborate closely with team members to develop and refine transition risk datasets and models, with a focus on carbon emissions modeling.Integrate transition risk metrics into financial risk models, ensuring alignment with industry best practices and regulatory requirements.Clean, wrangle, and analyze datasets.Communicate findings effectively through compelling data visualizations, reports, and presentations.Stay abreast of emerging trends, methodologies, and regulatory developments in sustainable finance and climate risk management.Contribute to thought leadership initiatives.

Knowledge And Experience

Bachelor's degree in environmental science, finance, economics, or a related field.2+ years of experience in quantitative analysis and statistical modeling, 2+ years of experience with tools such as R, Python, or SQL.2+ years of experience in data cleaning, wrangling, and visualization. Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to diverse audiences.General understanding of sustainable finance principles and practices.Background in Finance, Sustainability, Science, Energy, or another related field. 

Preferred

Master’s degree in environmental science, finance, economics, or a related field.Familiarity with financial modeling techniques, particularly in the context of credit risk and ratings.Experience conducting scenario analysis and assessing climate-related scenarios and models.

New York Base Salary Range 

The expected base salary for this role if located in New York City is between 70,000 - 113,000 USD. The base salary range does not include Intercontinental Exchange’s incentive compensation. While we provide this range as general guidance, at ICE we compensate employees based on the skillset and experience of the individual.

Intercontinental Exchange, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin or ancestry, age, disability or veteran status, or other protected status.

Experience Level (if available): None
